thread.title: Jets cut Darrelle Revis in end of an era
thread.title_full: Jets cut Darrelle Revis in end of an era | New York Post

author: Post Sports Desk
title: Jets cut Darrelle Revis in end of an era
text:
The Jets are done with Darrelle Revis.
One of the best players in the franchise’s history will be a cap casualty, The Post’s Brian Costello reported , ahead of a trial in which Revis faces four felony charges and one misdemeanor after a Pittsburgh street fight two weeks ago.
Revis was due $15.3 million for this season, which the Jets were not going to pay following his plunge in production in 2016. There was thought the Jets may ask him to take a paycut.
Revis, 31, was due a $2 million roster bonus March 10, so a decision had to be made before that cutoff.
“I can’t thank Woody Johnson and the entire Jets organization enough for taking a chance on me back in 2007,” Revis, a seven-time Pro Bowler, said in a statement . “I played some of my greatest football in green and white. Jet nation has always been behind me and teammates. Without all of you there would be no Revis Island. I love you New York ”
Revis, whom the Jets brought back in 2015 after they traded him in 2013, had suggested he could switch to safety, which would be easier for a slowing player. It is still believed he wants to play in 2017.
The Jets cutting Revis comes a day after they released another longtime staple in center Nick Mangold.
